{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:00.659
    | text      = Back on January 24th, 2020, Alex's ex-wife Kelly filed a petition in bankruptcy court. She was making a claim of involuntary bankruptcy and requesting relief under Chapter 11.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:13.659
    | text      = A claim of involuntary bankruptcy is one where a party who has owed money can file a petition to get that money they're owed, and if the party that owes the money can't pay it, they can be forced into bankruptcy involuntarily to pay the debt.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:25.659
    | text      = According to court filings, when they got divorced in 2015, Alex testified that he could not afford to pay the money that she was awarded in the divorce.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:56:34.659
    | text      = So he signed a real estate lien, which promised Kelly a certain amount of money related to their shared property, as well as 10% of the value of, quote, the businesses created during the Joneses' marriage in the state of Texas.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:57:16.659

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = to dismiss the involuntary petition or to enter any other appropriate order.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:00:55.659
    | text      = I normally might have considered something like this to be an element of Alex's personal life, which I generally err on the side of not covering, since it involves his divorce and ultimately, it's not about his worldview or rhetoric.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:07.659
    | text      = It's just a dispute about his payment or non-payment of money he owes his ex-wife, but I'd like to explain a couple reasons why I decided to bring this up on the show.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:15.659
    | text      = In the past six months or so, Alex has been way, way more fatalistic on air than I've ever seen him be before.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:21.659
    | text      = He's been finding himself talking about quitting and recognizing that the end might be near in ways that I don't find to be similar to other periods of his career that I've looked at.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:30.659
    | text      = Many of the things that he's dealing with could be what's driving that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:34.659
    | text      = From his supplement warnings to his upcoming Sandy Hook trial, there's a lot for him to worry about, and a lot of various things that you could think might be what he's worried will sink the ship.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:42.659
    | text      = I've considered all the dynamics at play, and I've become fairly convinced that this pending trial with his ex-wife is what's been motivating most of Alex's behavior over the past months.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:52.659
    | text      = Let me walk you through that reasoning.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:01:55.659
    | text      = According to her filing, the notification of non-payment from Alex came regarding the July and August note payments back in 2019.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:02.659
    | text      = You would assume that talk of filing a lawsuit over these defaulted payments wouldn't happen immediately.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:07.659
    | text      = You know, there's probably some grace period, so there's probably a pretty good chance things were normal for a little while.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:13.659
    | text      = Early September 2019 is when we started to hear Alex repeatedly have breakdowns, where he was talking about how Infos might not make it another year, and how he didn't know if he was going to reorder supplies.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:25.659
    | text      = Some of that definitely could have been about his need to sell out stock so he wouldn't have to pay taxes on carried-over inventory, but if you recall, he talked a whole lot about selling his house.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:33.659
    | text      = This is interesting because the debt that Alex has to Kelly is secured by liens on two properties that they had, and if Alex was found to be in default of his debt, one way it could be paid is by foreclosing on that property.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:46.659
    | text      = Alex knows that these houses are what is used to secure his debt, so if he knew that he wasn't making payments, it would stand to reason that he knew it was only a matter of time until he lost his house.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:02:55.659
    | text      = January 24th was the day that the bankruptcy filing was made, and there are a couple of interesting things that come from looking back at that show.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:04.659
    | text      = The first is that Alex couldn't start the show on time that day, and when he did come to the mic, this is how it started.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:11.659
    | text      = Reading all the news and all the information, this is probably one of the first times that I just physically could not go on air at the start of the broadcast.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:20.659
    | text      = And, you know, there really just comes a time when the world's just going to have to be judged.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
